response:
Urgent MRI is needed to confirm a structural or demyelinating lesion in the left parasagittal region and to characterise the optic nerve, guiding acute treatment and excluding compression before steroids. Ophthalmic tests further define the optic neuropathy. CSF and serological studies help distinguish multiple sclerosis from NMOSD, MOGAD, infection and other inflammatory or metabolic causes. Routine blood tests assess for metabolic contributors (B12 deficiency, diabetes control) and treatment safety. Neurophysiology helps identify any coexisting peripheral neuropathy.
